thread.title: UB Greensfelder Attorney Emma Tomsick Accepted into Ladder Down Cleveland Class of 2025
thread.title_full: UB Greensfelder Attorney Emma Tomsick Accepted into Ladder Down Cleveland Class of 2025

author: Press Release
title: UB Greensfelder Attorney Emma Tomsick Accepted into Ladder Down Cleveland Class of 2025
text:
Home » Stories » 2024 » December UB Greensfelder Attorney Emma Tomsick Accepted into Ladder Down Cleveland Class of 2025
Law Firm | Unsplash by Tingey Injury Law Firm
By Press Release Dec 26, 2024 UB Greensfelder LLP is pleased to announce that Associate Emma Tomsick has been accepted into the Ladder Down Cleveland Class of 2025. Tomsick was one of 28 attorneys accepted into the leadership, business development, and mentoring program created by women lawyers for women lawyers. Ladder Down Cleveland runs from January to November and includes women attorneys in private practice, solo practitioners, and in-house counsel at all levels of experience practicing in Northeast Ohio.
In her legal practice, Tomsick represents clients in employment and employee benefits matters, including defending employers in discrimination, harassment, restrictive covenant, retaliation, and wage and hour, and benefits litigation. She also helps clients manage labor relations, including addressing union campaigns, and represents broker-dealers and registered representatives in arbitrations before the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA). Using her previous business litigation experience, Tomsick helps clients mitigate risks and, when necessary, defends them in court and arbitration. She has been named to Best Lawyers: Ones to Watch® in America for her work in commercial litigation.
Launched in 2019, Ladder Down Cleveland for Women Lawyers is part of the Ladder Down program created in 2012 in Arizona by two female lawyers who wanted to help increase the number of women in law firm leadership positions by giving them the tools to rise and hold the "ladder down" for other women to follow and climb.
The Ladder Down Cleveland program provides nearly 20 hours of coaching in the critical areas of leadership, business development and mentoring. In addition, law firm partners, in-house counsel, judges, and other women leaders engage with the class through a series of panel discussions and other events. The program also includes periodic accountability sessions, where the class members work in focused, small groups to create and execute their leadership and business development plans.
Original source can be found here .
